Each year, the magic of the holiday season is brought to life through window displays in some of New York City’s famous designer shops and department stores. Take a peek at this year’s installations with these five must-see storefronts.

Macy's

This year, Macy’s holiday visuals celebrate the theme of “The Perfect Gift Brings People Together.” Their flagship store on 34th Street in Herald Square debuted the windows on November 16th with a display of fireworks, lights, and plenty of holiday-themed fanfare. All twenty-four windows are meticulously adorned and moonlight as imprressive works of art. Some of the most ornately designed include a Christmas tree as the centerpiece of a home, a busy New York City skyline, skating rink, and Santa Claus conducting a holiday orchestra. You can also spot their perennial window entitled "Yes Virginia, There is a Santa Claus,” impressively built for its 10th consecutive year. Take a short walk over to Seventh Avenue to reach Macy’s from the hotel. The installations are on display through January 1st.

 

Bloomingdale's

Following the theme of “The Greatest Showman,” Bloomingdale’s window’s have reimagined scenes from the soon-to-be-released Hugh Jackman-starring biopic “P. T. Barnum.” Each window flaunts a whimsical, action-packed display, including cannons, mannequin trapeze artists, and of course, replicas of Barnum himself. Quotes from the movie are also emblazoned on the glass panes, capturing the whimsical spirit of America’s “Greatest Showman.” The big reveal took place on November 21st, but can still be viewed throughout the holiday season. Hop on the E train at 34th Street - Penn Station a few blocks from our hotel to make your way to Bloomingdale’s.

 

Saks Fifth Avenue

Saks Fifth Avenue unveiled its theme of “Once Upon A Time” on November 20th with live performances, fireworks, and an extravagant display of lights flanking its facade at their flagship location in Midtown. The theme coincides with the 80th anniversary of Disney’s Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs. All of the characters make an appearance from memorable scenes including the march of the seven dwarfs, the evil queen speaking to the mirror on the wall, and Prince Charming’s magical kiss. The windows are on display through January 2nd. You can also watch a video of the unveiling online. Saks Fifth Avenue can be accessed from the hotel via a short train ride on the E.

Lord & Taylor

In collaboration with the Hallmark Channel and Madison Square Boys & Girls Club, Lord & Taylor chose the theme of “The Best And The Brightest” for its 80th annual holiday window installations. The big reveal took place on November 9th, following a captivating performance by country pop singer-songwriter Jessie James Decker. Over 60 variations of wintry scenes grace its flagship location, including high-fiving polar bears, a vintage-style circus, rabbits pouncing among snow-covered hills, and more. Additional displays can be found along 38th street, coinciding with the Hallmarks Channel’s Countdown to Christmas, which streams classic holiday movies for each day of December. The windows will remain decorated throughout the holiday season. Make your way there by taking a 15-minute walk or short cab ride from the hotel.

Tiffany & Co.

Tiffany & Co.’s iconic blue box take center stage in their brightly hued window displays this season, designed by the jewelry company’s Art Director and Vice President, Gene Moore. Debuted on November 13th, the windows welcoming the crowd with array of tiny figurines  lugging along presents, fishing, and ice skating whilst ensconced in diamond-dusted trees and thousands-of-dollars worth of designer jewels. Some of our favorite new jewels can be spotted, including a diamond-wrapped watch, amazonite-encrusted bracelets, and a bouquet of bezel-set engagement rings. Be sure to stop by before January sixth! Their flagship location is six stops away from the hotel on the E train.
